title: Comparing Mean and Standard Deviation from Two Histograms
question_text:
Created for Albert.io. Copyright 2017. All rights reserved.

The histograms above represent the distribution for Ms. Dorman's students' test scores on the first two chapter tests. [question-stem] Which of the following statements is true?[question-stem]

choices.text: Chapter One has the larger mean and the larger standard deviation.
Chapter One has the larger mean, but Chapter Two has the larger standard deviation.
Chapter Two has the larger mean, but Chapter One has the larger standard deviation.
Chapter Two has the larger mean and the larger standard deviation.
Chapter One and Chapter Two have the same mean and standard deviation.

solution:
Since both distributions are approximately normal, the means can be found in the peak.

In this case, we can see that the mean of the Chapter One test is between
70
to
79
, and for the Chapter Two test, the mean is between
80
to
89
. Since Chapter Two has the larger mean test score, we can eliminate Choices 'A', 'B' and 'E'.

Standard deviation is a type of spread. Since both shapes are approximately normal, we are looking for the graph that is more spread out. In this case, it is the Chapter One test, which eliminates Choice 'D' and makes Choice 'C' the solution.
